sentence.text: We show here that histone deacetylation depletion in MYCN-driven neuroblastoma cell lines strongly induces cell death, mostly mediated by apoptotic programs.
Our study identified a group of cell cycle-promoting genes regulated by histone deacetylation, being both predictors of unfavorable patient outcome and essential for tumor cell viability.

The data indicate a significant role of histone deacetylation for mitotic cell cycle progression and survival of MYCN-amplified neuroblastoma cells, and suggests that HDAC11 could be a valuable drug target
